translation.en: You see, our story actually begins here,
in the Land of Frozen Food…
and dreams, well, they get frozen, too.
This is Waffles. And her little buddy right there?
Two best friends with one big dream,
But let's just say their cooking was a little on the…
But those two, they kept at it.

translation.ko: 그러던 어느 날 창밖에 뭔가 나타났어요

translation.en: Our store's truck had gotten stuck in the snow.
translation.ko: 눈더미에 갇힌 우리 가게의 운송 트럭이었죠

translation.en: Do you think that truck is going somewhere with real, live, fresh food?
translation.ko: 저 트럭은 진짜 살아있는 신선한 음식을 싣고 가는 걸까?

translation.en: We've gotta have courage, Mochi, or we'll never learn how to cook.
translation.ko: 모찌, 용기를 내자 요리를 배울 마지막 기회야

translation.en: You know what? Let's blow this Popsicle stand.
[woman] And just like that, Waffles and Mochi set off
translation.ko: 바로 이렇게 와플과 모찌는 인생에서 가장 맛있는

translation.en: on the tastiest adventure of their lives.
translation.ko: 와플과 모찌는 인생에서 가장 맛있는 모험을 떠났답니다

translation.en: -[Waffles] Mochi, are we there yet? -[Mochi meeps]
♪ And eat your parents With Waffles & Mochi ♪
look at all this fresh food.
Well, my dad is a frozen waffle.
This is my best friend Mochi, I'm Waffles.
translation.ko: 얘는 내 절친 모찌, 난 와플이야

translation.en: It's all right. We'll get this cleaned up.
Oh. All right. That's me. Here we go.
Well, nice to meet ya, Steve.
This place is so cool. What do you all do here?
translation.ko: 정말 멋진 곳이다 다들 여기서 뭐 해?

translation.en: Huh! That's easy. We work here!
Uh! Can we work here, too?
You'll have to ask our store owner.
She's the one to ask about working here.
-What can I do for ya? -We wanna work in the supermarket.
translation.ko: 뭘 도와주면 될까? 슈퍼마켓에서 일하고 싶어요

translation.en: Have you worked in a supermarket before?
-No. -Okay. Have you ever had a job before?
translation.ko: - 아뇨 - 그래 직업을 가져 본 적 있고?

translation.en: Do you even know what a job is?
Why don't we give you a chance?
-We'd love that. -Let's start with something simple.
What a beautiful basket of clown noses.
-[murmurs] -I picked them fresh from the garden. Wow.
All you have to do is go downstairs and put them where they belong.
translation.ko: 너희가 할 일은 이걸 아래층에 가져가서 제자리에 놓는 거야

translation.en: No way they'll be able to do this.
-Can you do that? -No problemo, Mrs. Obama.
translation.ko: - 할 수 있겠어? - 그럼요, 오바마 부인

translation.en: Jeez, I wish we had something that could move this, like a…
translation.ko: 이걸 옮길 장비가 있으면 좋겠는데 스케이트보드나 롤러스케이트 같은 거

translation.en: like a skateboard or a roller skate or a…
Looks like they're gonna take the MagiCart.
Um, hi, magical super shopping cart of our dreams.
translation.ko: 안녕, 꿈에 그리던 신비한 슈퍼 쇼핑 카트야

translation.en: I see you need help finding out where tomatoes belong.
Please put on your safety gear and seat belts.
What? We need to do all that? Aren't we just going downstairs?
translation.ko: 그런 것도 해야 해? 아래층에는 안 가?

translation.en: I think we need to gear up.
[MagiCart] Our first stop is Oakland, California,
translation.ko: 첫 번째 목적지 캘리포니아주 오클랜드에 가서

translation.en: where you'll meet Chef Samin Nosrat from the TV show Salt Fat Acid Heat.
translation.ko: 사민 노스랏 셰프를 만날 거야 TV쇼 '소금. 산. 지방. 불'에 출연하신 분이지

translation.en: -I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi. -Oh, hi. I'm Samin.
translation.ko: 저는 와플, 얘는 모찌예요 안녕, 난 사민이야

translation.en: -No. We're figuring out where we belong. -[murmurs]
translation.ko: 아뇨, 저희 자리가 어딘지 찾고 있어요

translation.en: What we need to figure out is where tomatoes belong.
translation.ko: 사실 찾아야 할 건 토마토의 자리예요

translation.en: Have you had a tomato before?
-No. -Would you like to taste one of these?
One of my favorite kinds. Cherry tomatoes.
-[Wafles gasps] -[Samin] What does that taste like?
It's juicy, and it burst in my mouth.
Is this the first time you had a fresh tomato?
It really is. I don't know how to process it.
There are actually 10,000 varieties of tomatoes around the world.
So, people all over the world cook them in all different ways.
translation.ko: 전 세계 사람들이 다양한 방식으로 요리하지

translation.en: Yeah. Do you wanna see the other tomatoes I picked?
translation.ko: 그럼, 내가 수확한 다른 토마토들도 볼래?

translation.en: Let's do it. And you know who else is gonna come join us?
translation.ko: 가서 보자, 함께할 사람이 또 있어

translation.en: [gasps] Hi, Mia. I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi.
translation.ko: 안녕, 미아 난 와플, 얘는 모찌야

translation.en: Do you know what a fruit is?
Do I know what a fruit is? Of course I do.
It's a thingamajig that you put on your shelf and admire.
translation.ko: 그게 뭐라더라 선반에 올려놓고 감상하는 거야

translation.en: Yeah, but can't you eat cheese pizza, too?
translation.ko: 맞아, 그런데 치즈피자도 먹을 수 있잖아?

translation.en: It's something that, when you cut it, the seeds are inside.
translation.ko: 과일은 반으로 자르면 안쪽에 씨가 있어

translation.en: I'll squirt some in your mouth. [Samin squeaks]
Do you think there's gonna be seeds on the inside of the tomatoes?
[Samin] Do you see all those tiny seeds?
It's got seeds on the inside, Mochi.
It means that a tomato's a fruit.
Ah! A tomato is a fruit.
Are you guys ready to make some pasta with tomato candy?
Waffles, you're in charge of the cheese.
-I need you to grate it. -All right.
Keep grating, and don't stop until I tell you you're done.
translation.ko: 내가 그만하라고 할 때까지 계속 갈아야 해

translation.en: Mia, we're gonna put a bunch of tomatoes in this bowl.
-[Mia] Watch out, Mochi. -Grating cheese is like a workout.
translation.ko: 조심해, 모찌 치즈 가는 것도 운동이 되네요

translation.en: -[Mia] Good job, Waffles. -Now, we're gonna put some salt,
translation.ko: 넌 잘하고 있어, 와플 이제 소금을 조금 넣고

translation.en: and some olive oil to help make it stick.
That's gonna make the tomatoes extra delicious.
Now, we're gonna put 'em in our oven.
In the meantime, we can get everything else ready.
translation.ko: 그동안 우린 다른 재료를 준비할 수 있어

translation.en: Sorry, Mochi. I'm resting my arm.
translation.ko: 미안, 모찌, 내 팔도 좀 쉬어야지

translation.en: Mia, will you help pick the basil?
translation.ko: 미아는 바질 잎 고르는 거 도와줄래?

translation.en: All we have to do now is cook the pasta.
I think you did it all.
The pasta might be ready. Should we check?
Mia, will you help by adding the basil into the bowl?
Now, we can add our last ingredient.
[Samin] Wait till you taste 'em. They taste like candy.
translation.ko: 맛볼 때까지 기다려 - 네 - 사탕 맛이 날 거야

translation.en: We should put the whole tray in.
-Should I just dump it in? -Dump it all!
-[Waffles laughs] -Know what the finishing touch is?
-[Mia] Cheese! -[Samin] Time to have a bite.
-Don't tomatoes taste like candy? -[Waffles] That is amazing.
translation.ko: - 토마토가 사탕 같지 않아? - 정말 맛있어요

translation.en: I can't believe we just met, and now we're eating together.
translation.ko: 만난 지 얼마 안 됐는데 함께 식사까지 하다니 신기해요

translation.en: That's what cooking and eating together can do.
translation.ko: 그래서 함께 요리하고 먹는 게 우리한테 소중한 거지

translation.en: And now we know where tomatoes belong.
♪ And I wouldn't be if I could ♪
♪ Put me in a certain aisle ♪
♪ Like there's no more to discover ♪
♪ But you gotta read my whole book ♪
♪ Not just look at the cover ♪
♪ People take one look at me And they think they know who I am ♪
translation.ko: 그저 한 번만 보고 날 판단하려 하지 마

translation.en: ♪ But I'm here to say Once and for all ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
♪ And no matter What kind of tomato you are ♪
♪ Sliced or diced or in a jar ♪
♪ In ketchup or on a salad bar ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
[Waffles] Mochi, I can't believe we just ate food that was not frozen.
translation.ko: 모찌, 우리가 냉동 아닌 걸 먹다니 정말 신기해

translation.en: Look at those tomatoes, Mochi. Should we go inside?
So, we saw a tomato outside.
Is this a tomato restaurant? Can we order tomatoes?
translation.ko: 여긴 토마토 식당인가요? 토마토 주문해도 돼요?

translation.en: You have come to the best place to eat pizza.
translation.ko: 너희는 최고의 피자를 맛볼 수 있는 곳에 온 거야

translation.en: -[Waffles] They make pizza here? -They make the best pizza.
-Hey, what are you doing with your hands? -I'm talking with my hands,
translation.ko: 손은 왜 자꾸 움직여요? 손으로 이야기하는 거야

translation.en: because everyone who works here is Deaf,
and they communicate by using their hands.
What does it mean when you're Deaf?
What it means when you're Deaf-- It means you can't hear.
translation.ko: 소리를 못 듣는 사람을 농인이라고 하는데

translation.en: You don't use your ears to hear.
You use your eyes to hear.
So, everyone here uses their hands to talk?
translation.ko: 여기는 모두 손을 이용해서 이야기 하나요?

translation.en: That's right. What's your favorite pizza?
[Katie translates] The Margherita is the most delicious because of the sauce,
translation.ko: 마르게리타 피자는 소스 때문에 가장 맛있는 피자래

translation.en: and the sauce is pretty much just tomato.
I had no idea so much tomato went into pizza.
Do you know what I think is the coolest part about this restaurant?
translation.ko: 이 식당에서 가장 멋진 부분이 뭔지 알아?

translation.en: The staff uses their hands to communicate,
but they're also using their hands
and the food are the same.
-This is Amanda. This is her place. -Hi.
It's all melted together and warm. Mochi, get in on this.
translation.ko: 입에서 살살 녹고 따뜻해요 모찌, 너도 먹어봐

translation.en: -[Waffles] What did you think, bud? -[Mochi trilling]
Wow, so awesome that tomatoes are fruits.
As soon as we put tomatoes in the fruit section,
we get to stay at the grocery store forever.
translation.ko: 우린 식료품 가게에서 평생 일할 수 있어요

translation.en: Well, technically, a tomato is a fruit,
but chefs use it like it's a vegetable.
What? Wait, wait, wait. You're saying that a tomato is a vegetable?
Does it belong with the fruits? With vegetables?
[Waffles] Come on. We gotta get out of here. Vegetable fruit.
translation.ko: 모찌, 어서 여기서 나가자 채소 과일이라니

translation.en: Oh. Excuse me. Can I take a bite for the road?
[translating from Italian] A tomato is a fruit.
[from Japanese] Fruit, because tomatoes are sweet.
[from Italian] Vegetable. It's not sweet enough.
Why? Because it has seeds inside.
MagiCart, help. We thought tomato was a fruit,
translation.ko: 매지카트, 도와줘 토마토가 과일인 줄 알았는데

translation.en: but then we heard it's a vegetable.
Well, a fruit is the part of a plant with seeds.
Everything else, like the plant's roots, stems, and leaves, are vegetables.
translation.ko: 그 외에 식물의 뿌리나 줄기, 잎은 채소야

translation.en: You're gonna tell us where tomatoes go in the store, right?
translation.ko: 그럼, 슈퍼에 토마토 자리가 어딘지도 알려 줄 거지?

translation.en: No, but I know just the person to ask.
translation.ko: 아니, 하지만 답을 알려 주실 분은 알아

translation.en: Let's swing by Washington, D.C., and ask Chef José Andrés.
translation.ko: 워싱턴 DC의 호세 안드레스 셰프한테 물어봐

translation.en: He wrote the book on vegetables. Literally.
Sounds like the perfect person to ask.
Would you expect anything less from me?
Well, we don't even know you yet, MagiCart. Cool it.
translation.ko: 아직 너를 잘 모르잖아 매지카트, 진정해

translation.en: Where are we? Oh, hey. Excuse me.
Maybe you can help us. We're confused.
We need to put tomatoes away at the store.
We learned it was a fruit, then someone told us it was a vegetable.
translation.ko: 과일인 줄 알았더니 어떤 사람은 채소라고 하고

translation.en: So where does it belong, you know?
Well, technically, technically, it's a fruit.
Why? Because we use it in salads.
We use it in savory dishes.
So, you're saying that a tomato can be a fruit and a vegetable?
translation.ko: 그럼 토마토가 과일도 되고 채소도 된다는 건가요?

translation.en: Yes. And you will be right in both ways.
We're gonna make a recipe that I learned from my wife.
translation.ko: 요리를 하나 해보자 내 아내한테 배운 조리법인데

translation.en: Gazpacho is from the south of Spain.
It's always hot weather because it's always a beautiful sun in the sky.
translation.ko: 거긴 늘 아름다운 태양이 빛나서 항상 푹푹 찌는 곳이야

translation.en: Oh, so who wants hot soup in a hot-weather place?
translation.ko: 푹푹 찌는 날에 뜨거운 수프를 누가 먹어요?

translation.en: And then, one of my favorite ingredients.
-What do you think is it? -Is that olive oil?
From olives from the olive tree.
You wanna honor the tradition of Spain, you put sherry vinegar.
translation.ko: 스페인의 전통 방식은 셰리 식초를 넣어

translation.en: All right. So, the tomato is ready.
This is what you do. You chop the tomatoes into cubes,
translation.ko: 이렇게 만드는 거야 토마토를 정육면체로 썰어서

translation.en: and you put the cubes in the plate.
A bit of the olive oil,
and now we need to finish with your favorite new friend.
translation.ko: 이제 너희가 좋아하는 새 친구를 넣어서 마무리해

translation.en: A big cut on the top,
and then you make a cut right there.
And now, you let the party begin.
-Do you hear? Can you hear the sound? -[voice vocalizes softly]
-[faint crackling] -All these sound is that they are happy.
Well, we came from the Land of Frozen Foods,
where everything was frozen and came here. We didn't know where we belonged.
translation.ko: 모든 게 냉동인 곳에서만 살다 왔더니 저희 자리를 못 찾겠어요

translation.en: is telling a lot of who I am,
translation.ko: 내가 누구인지 많은 걸 말해주는 거 같아

translation.en: and I think it's gonna give you clues to finding who you are, where you're going, because,
translation.ko: 너희가 누구인지 어디로 향해 가는지도 알려줄 거야

translation.en: this gazpacho is from Spain, but then,
translation.ko: 가스파초는 스페인에서 왔지만 들어가는 재료는 세계 각지에서 온 거잖아

translation.en: many ingredients came from other parts of the world.
translation.ko: 들어가는 재료는 세계 각지에서 온 거잖아

translation.en: I learned that gazpacho can be… from anywhere.
translation.ko: 가스파초는 어느 곳에든 있을 수 있어

translation.en: It belongs to a place that people gives love to the gazpacho.
translation.ko: 가스파초를 사랑하는 사람들이 있는 곳이면 어디든 가능하지

translation.en: Hopefully, we can figure out where we belong.
If we listen to our food, maybe it'll tell us who we are.
translation.ko: 음식에 귀를 기울이면 어딘지 알려줄지도 몰라요

translation.en: You two ready to put those tomatoes where they belong?
Yeah. Mochi, we've got a job to do.
translation.ko: 응, 모찌, 우린 할 일이 있어

translation.en: All right, Mochi. Wait, you're not Mochi.
Mochi, we can put these tomatoes away. We know where they belong.
translation.ko: 모찌, 토마토를 진열하자 제자리가 어딘지 알잖아

translation.en: Wait, you think they're a vegetable?
But Samin said they're a fruit.
Chef José said people use them like vegetables, but…
translation.ko: 호세 셰프는 사람들이 토마토를 채소로 쓴다고 했는데

translation.en: [Busy] Wanted to spend time with my mentor. See the rosemary spread?
translation.ko: 멘토님과 있으면 좋아요 로즈메리 스프레드도 있어요

translation.en: Wow, and the bakery is really--
-Hey, you two. -Well, if it isn't Falafel and Mocha.
I heard somebody is trying to figure out where tomatoes go.
translation.ko: 토마토 진열할 곳을 고민하는 분이 계시다던데요

translation.en: Well, I guess that is a choice.
Not a good choice, if you ask me.
We put them everywhere because they can go anywhere.
translation.ko: 어디든 쓰일 수 있어서 사방에 진열해 놨어요

translation.en: Tomatoes are a fruit because their seeds are inside.
But tomatoes are also a vegetable
because that's how chefs and most people use them.
You two showed me a new way to think about tomatoes.
translation.ko: 덕분에 토마토에 관한 새로운 시각이 생겼어

translation.en: And you see, whenever an employee demonstrates a high level of mastery
translation.ko: 우리 직원들은 식료품에 관해 높은 수준의 지식을 선보이면 권위 있는 상을 받아

translation.en: of our edible inventory, they're awarded a prestigious honor.
translation.ko: 높은 수준의 지식을 선보이면 권위 있는 상을 받아

translation.en: What Busy is trying to say is that when employees around here
translation.ko: 비지가 하는 말이 뭐냐면 우리 직원들은 잘한 일 있거나 전문성을 보여주면

translation.en: do something good and show an expertise in something, they get a badge.
translation.ko: 우리 직원들은 잘한 일 있거나 전문성을 보여주면 배지를 받거든

translation.en: So, it is my distinct honor
I want to tell you both how proud I am of you.
you didn't give up on finding where you belong.
translation.ko: 너희 자리를 찾는 것도 포기하지 않았어

translation.en: And I can only imagine how you two must have felt,
that you belong, like the tomato, everywhere.
I want to reward you proudly
-[Mrs. Obama] In honor of your tenacity -[meeps]
you now belong here with us. You're a part of our family.
translation.ko: 이제 여기가 너희 자리고 우리 가족이 됐어

translation.en: So, where do we put these?
On your official apron, of course.
-Busy. Join us. -I'll get in on it, too.
